title: Chief Strategy and Corporate Development Officer, Relias
description: Mike Mutka is the Chief Strategy and Corporate Development Officer at Relias Learning. Previously he was the Executive Vice President of Sales and Marketing. Prior to this position, he was President of Silverchair Learning Systems, LLC, which is now part of Relias Learning. Mike also served as the company’s Executive Vice President of Sales and Marketing from 2005-2009. During that time, he built the sales and marketing organization from just two people to a team of 20+ professionals with an impressive track record of growth. Prior to Silverchair Learning, Mike worked for the Hill-Rom Company, Berchtold Corporation, and Briggs Healthcare, all leaders in their markets, and gained extensive experience in new product development, sales and marketing management, strategic planning, and Kaizen continuous improvement methodology. He earned a Bachelor’s degree in Business and an MBA in Marketing from Indiana University‘s Kelley School of Business.

title: Translational Neuroscience Strategist, Relias
description: Dr. Clayton is a licensed, practicing psychologist with 30 years of healthcare experience in the public and private sector, including non-profit and private practice work. She currently works as the Translational Neuroscientist for Relias, a NC Based Company specializing in online workforce development and training. Before joining Relias, Dr. Clayton served as the CEO of Care Management Technologies, a health IT data analytics company recently acquired by Relias. Prior to her tenure as CEO of CMT, Dr. Clayton served as the Executive Director for the North Carolina Council of Community MH/DD/SA Programs, a nonprofit corporation representing public MH/DD/SA service organizations. She began her career as a psychologist at a local NC state psychiatric facility followed by leading regional public community health child and family services under a capitated Medicaid waiver in NC. Dr. Clayton also served as the Executive Director for Magellan Health Services for the South Atlantic states of North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee and Georgia. She has broad public and private sector management and leadership experience.

title: Former Prime Minister, Republic of Haiti
description: Laurent S. Lamothe successfully served as Prime Minister of Haiti from May 2012 to December 2014, the longest tenure of any Prime Minister in the last three decades. During his time in office, Lamothe presided over the design and implementation of an important social policy agenda targeting the poorest sectors of the Haitian population. He also presided over the largest infrastructure development in recent memory.

title: Training and Development Specialist, Bethesda Lutheran Communities
description: Greg He holds a Masters degree in Education from the University of Wisconsin - La Crosse as well as a Bachelors degree in Special Education from University of Wisconsin - Whitewater. He is a member of the American Association of Educators and the Wisconsin State Reading Association.

title: Director of Professional Services, Relias
description: Candace joined Relias Learning in 2013. While at Relias, Candace has held the positions of Support Consultant, Client Success Manager, Support Manager, and now Director of Support. Candace is responsible for all areas of client support at Relias Learning and is supported by an amazing team of Support Consultants, Client Success Managers, Solutions Consultants, and Managers. Previously, Candace worked as Laboratory Director for Archaeological Research at Atkins. Candace holds Bachelor’s degrees in both Archaeology and Religion from Baylor University.

title: Director of Accounts Management, Relias Learning

description: Ms. Minor has been working for 25 years at Wheeler Clinic in many roles including leading community-based prevention programs, training in diverse adult and youth settings and most recently as Staff Development Manager. Ms. Minor also is an adjunct faculty member at the University of Connecticut Master’s in Public Health program. Prior experience includes directing a large citywide HIV/AIDS program, overseeing all aspects of a women’s clinic and providing direct client care in both an inner city clinic and a hospital. Ms. Minor earned her Bachelor’s degree in Biology at the University of Connecticut, her Physician Assistant professional certificate from the United States Public Health Services Hospital in Staten Island, NY and her Master’s in Health Services from California College for Health Sciences.

Ms. Joseph has worked in healthcare settings for 20 years, including hospital based acute care and community health centers in the role of staff nurse, infection prevention and control, staff development and training, as well as executive leadership.  Heidi is a Connecticut native and earned her Bachelors of Nursing from University of Saint Joseph, Masters in Nurse from University of Hartford and is currently pursuing a Doctorate of Nursing Practice in Leadership at Quinnipiac University.  She currently oversees daily operations of the integrated Health and Wellness Centers at Wheeler Clinic.

title: Author and Paralympian
description: Josh a bestselling author, motivational speaker, and Paralympic ski racer. He has spoken across the world to groups ranging from Fortune 500 companies to inner city public schools to the White House. At age nine, Josh was diagnosed with a rare form of bone cancer and given a fifty percent chance to live. He spent a year on chemotherapy treatments and his left leg was amputated. Doctors declared Josh cured of the disease at age thirteen and he took up ski racing three years later. He trained for the next six years and in 2006 he was named to the US Paralympic Ski Team for the 2006 Paralympics in Turino, Italy.

title: CEO, WhiteCloud Analytics
description: Bob Lokken serves as the VP of Analytics for Relias Learning. Lokken recently joined the Relias team from WhiteCloud Analytics, where he was founder and CEO. Also, Lokken serves on the System Board of Trustees for St. Luke’s Health System, and serves as Chairman of the Board of Directors of Idaho Business for Education, a business advocacy organization of 185 CEO’s across the state.

title: Central City Concern
description: Alex has eight years of experience in social services and non-profit administration, including pioneering Central City Concern’s training function, growing the department, and developing and implementing the Relias Learning Management System for 900 active users. While working at Central City Concern, Alex completed graduate studies in public health in 2015 with a focus on statistics and a passion for data visualization. In additional to formal education, Alex is knowledgeable in participatory leadership, group facilitation, and lean management.

title: Staff Development Coordinator, Covenant Woods
description: Alexis has been working as a Staff Development Coordinator since October 2015, a transition from teaching in a public school. She has been facilitating New Hire Orientations since November 2015. Alexis is a member of the national Association for Talent Development as well as her local chapter.

title: Senior Partner for Analytic Solutions, WhiteCloud Analytics
description: Alyson has spent most of her career creating and deploying business intelligence products and solutions. At WhiteCloud, she is responsible for a team of developers who create custom analytic solutions for St. Luke’s Health System (a top 15 hospital) and other WhiteCloud customers. Prior to joining WhiteCloud, Alyson was a senior program manager for Microsoft, where she was responsible for collecting customer feedback, ensuring early adopter success, and managing early adopter programs for PerformancePoint Services. Previously, Alyson was a technical product manager for ProClarity Corporation, responsible for customer programs, product feedback, and early deployments, and a senior consultant deploying business intelligence solutions, and creating and delivering training materials. She has been a featured speaker at several business intelligence and technical conferences, including TechEd, SQL PASS, and the Microsoft BI Conference, among others. Alyson holds a BS in Mathematics from Idaho State University. As a dedicated runner, Alyson has been known to strap on a head lamp and traction devices so that she could run in the dark on icy winter roads.

title: Learning Development Specialist, Children’s Home Society of Florida
description: Amanda has a master’s degree in Education and has been a learning management systems administrator for 11 years and has worked with Relias for five years. She manages the Children’s Home Society of Florida’s training program.

title: Training and Development Associate, South Fort Myers Life Plan Community of Cypress Cove at HealthPark Florida
Training and Workforce Administrator, Mercy Maricopa Integrated Care
description: Amrita Sethi has been employed in the fields of allied health education and managed care training for 20 years. After earning her BS in Biotechnology from Rochester Institute of Technology, she worked briefly as a research associate in the field. Amrita realized that teaching was a passion of hers after working as a high school teacher in the areas of math and science. Amrita then transitioned to lead and teach allied health professionals and educators for several years prior to joining the world of corporate training. She led a team of training professionals for a large financial organization and then joined Aetna Medicaid health plans. Throughout her 11 year career for Aetna Medicaid she held several training leadership positions. In her current role for Mercy Maricopa Integrated Care, a health plan managed by Aetna Medicaid she leads of team of operational and clinical professionals responsible for the oversight of training for more than 11,000 individuals in Maricopa County. She has also earned a Master’s in Business Administration and a Doctorate of Health Care Administration.
